review_content: Can from a local Japanese supermarket. Pours gold with the usual white head. The tiny bit of aroma it gives consists of a slight bit of malt, and some hops too. Slight malt, more hops the taste; thin and poor mouthfeel. Soft carbonation too. Bitter aftertaste, a bit on the bitter side for a pale lager, slightly pils-like.
Malty and light hops. Abit biscuity and grassy. Slight bitter. Mildly sweet. Clean and crisp. Extremely refreshing and quaffable.

Golden, Bright, white beerhead, with frothy, creamy and lacing foam. Good retention. Clean malty fragrance, pairing with light hoppy aroma, the flavor is mainly malty and focusing on the barley malt. No grassy hints, great drinkability. Light sweetness, light bitterness, medium carbonation, crispy touch and dry in finish. Slight bitterness lingering.
Bottle at ramen shop near furano. Nice golden colour but hög standard lager.

12oz can from a Toyko 7-11.  Can't see it.  Smells like corn and grist and straw.  Flavor isn't terrible, corn and grist, white flour, underbaked biscuit.  Nothing too trashy.  Crisp finish.  This is decent bad beer.
21 oktober 2019. Kanazawa. Getapt?  Restaurant. Middle-of-the-road bier. Niet veel smaak aan.

Fantastic biscuity malt with a subtle bittering hop after swallowing is just enough to linger for a moment. Then have another sip and enjoy.

Too expensive however.

very clear golden with small white head. sounds silly to repeat an advertising line, but actual "fine malt", smells like very carefully processed and clean malt, very small smokiness, high minerality, clean earthy hops, very small bit of banana. malty and slightly bitter. good solid body. an ideal full malt east asian lager. if it was cheaper i'd get it all the time.
330ml Dose. Klar und Golden mit kleiner Schaumkrone. Getreidig. Bisschen Malz. Mild im Geschmack. Typisches Industrielager, aber trinkbar.

05.08.2019, 0,35l can @ hotel room in Tokyo:

Nice fizzy-creamy mediumlasting head, clear light golden color. Aroma is slightly dry sour-ish grassy, weeds, hay, dried grain, alcohol, sour grass, minerals, bark, soil. Taste is slightly sweet sour-ish grassy, weeds, bark, sour grass, grain, minerals, paper, alcohol, soil, metal tank, cardboard. Medium to longlasting bitterness, harsh sour-ish mineraly mouthfeel. Meh!
Pale golden color, small white head. Aroma of malt, grain, grassy hops. Dry lightly sweet taste with medium bitterness in finish and aftertaste. Drinkable pale lager.

0,35l can brought by wiosna from Japan, shared @ home. Pours clear golden with a medium head. Aroma is clean malts. Flavor is slightly sweet clean malts with some hops in the finish. Pretty good basic lager.

Yebisu Premium has a thick, off-white head, a clear, bubbly, golden appearance, with some glass lacing. The aroma is of rich barley and grass, and the flavor is similar, along with some fairly strong hop bitterness. Mouthfeel is medium, and Yebisu Premium finishes crisp. RJT
우리가 흔히 말하는 (시원한) 맥주 중 맛이 가장 깊습니다. 다르게 말하면 쓴 맛이 강합니다. 비슷한 계통의 맥주를 마시다가 이것을 마시면 쓴맛이 너무 강해 쇠맛을 느낄 수도 있습니다. 맥주 고유의 쓴 맛을 좋아하면 추천합니다.

Draft at Sapporo Bier Garten, Sapporo, Japan. Pours perfectly crisp, classic lager gold, with moderate white foam. Aroma is grainy, a little grassy, maybe lemongrass. Body is average with good carbonation. Taste is fairly sweet, with a little tail of bitterness. Finish is regular.

Can from a local Japanese supermarket. Pours gold with the usual white head. The tiny bit of aroma it gives consists of a slight bit of malt, and some hops too. Slight malt, more hops the taste; thin and poor mouthfeel. Soft carbonation too. Bitter aftertaste, a…
Malty and light hops. Abit biscuity and grassy. Slight bitter. Mildly sweet. Clean and crisp. Extremely refreshing and quaffable.

Golden, Bright, white beerhead, with frothy, creamy and lacing foam. Good retention. Clean malty fragrance, pairing with light hoppy aroma, the flavor is mainly malty and focusing on the barley malt. No grassy hints, great drinkability. Light sweetness, light…
Bottle at ramen shop near furano. Nice golden colour but hög standard lager.

12oz can from a Toyko 7-11.  Can't see it.  Smells like corn and grist and straw.  Flavor isn't terrible, corn and grist, white flour, underbaked biscuit.  Nothing too trashy.  Crisp finish.  This is decent bad beer.
21 oktober 2019. Kanazawa. Getapt?  Restaurant. Middle-of-the-road bier. Niet veel smaak aan.
Fantastic biscuity malt with a subtle bittering hop after swallowing is just enough to linger for a moment. Then have another sip and enjoy.…

very clear golden with small white head. sounds silly to repeat an advertising line, but actual "fine malt", smells like very carefully processed and clean malt, very small smokiness, high minerality, clean earthy hops, very small bit of banana. malty and…
330ml Dose. Klar und Golden mit kleiner Schaumkrone. Getreidig. Bisschen Malz. Mild im Geschmack. Typisches Industrielager, aber trinkbar.
05.08.2019, 0,35l can @ hotel room in Tokyo: Nice fizzy-creamy mediumlasting head, clear light golden color. Aroma is slightly dry…
Pale golden color, small white head. Aroma of malt, grain, grassy hops. Dry lightly sweet taste with medium bitterness in finish and aftertaste. Drinkable pale lager.

0,35l can brought by wiosna from Japan, shared @ home. Pours clear golden with a medium head. Aroma is clean malts. Flavor is slightly sweet clean malts with some hops in the finish. Pretty good basic lager.

Yebisu Premium has a thick, off-white head, a clear, bubbly, golden appearance, with some glass lacing. The aroma is of rich barley and grass, and the flavor is similar, along with some fairly strong hop bitterness. Mouthfeel is medium, and Yebisu Premium…
우리가 흔히 말하는 (시원한) 맥주 중 맛이 가장 깊습니다. 다르게 말하면 쓴 맛이 강합니다. 비슷한 계통의 맥주를 마시다가 이것을 마시면 쓴맛이 너무 강해 쇠맛을 느낄 수도 있습니다. 맥주 고유의 쓴 맛을 좋아하면 추천합니다.

Draft at Sapporo Bier Garten, Sapporo, Japan. Pours perfectly crisp, classic lager gold, with moderate white foam. Aroma is grainy, a little grassy, maybe lemongrass. Body is average with good carbonation. Taste is fairly sweet, with a little tail of bitterness.…

At a tasting, thanks, small bubbly head, clear intense yellow color, light malty aroma with just as hint of honey., biscuity fruity aroma wit ha medium herbal bitterness, light sweetness, quite crisp. Fair and drinkable.
Can at a tasting, thanks Yoav. Aroma is grainy and floral, a bit vegetal, Grainy, sweetish malt, herbal bitterness, earthy with dry finish. Quite drinkable. Not bad.
Prilično ok pivo,  malo rijetko i presvijetlo,  ali skroz ok.  Po alo slatkasto,  bez puno gorčine,  sa laganim citrusnim notama

5%ABV. Czech Pils.

Poured out yello. 6ºSRM.

Nose is beery and malty.

Mouthfeel is beery and carbonated. Palate has pale malt with crackers and wheat toast. There is a bit of flour and dough in the palate as well suggesting wheat malt. Hop flavors are pronounced and come in a the end with a woody, noble hop bitter, almost sappy with a strong hit of fresh grass.

Finish is brief-medium with a woody sappy bitter.

Overall a pretty refreshing, hop-forward Czech pils styled beer.

Draught Yebisu Bar Tokyo. Golden color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, toast, a bit of hops, malts and grass. Bitter finish with citrus, malts, toast, grass and a bit of hops. Basic bulk lager.

350ml Can from Family Mart, Hanzomon, Tokyo (¥242):

A very basic & cheap tasting lager that didn't have a whole lot going on really, I can now see why this is one of the Japanese lagers that never seems to make it as far as the UK. It was an easy enough beer to drink, mainly down to the fact that it was light & bland for the most part, it was however relatively skunk free expect for at the very end of the taste but it's not really one that I'd recommend.
From old tasting notes. Pale yellow gold color. Tart, crisp malt flavor hints at lemon peel and yeast. Nice dry hop finish. Good balance. Refreshing flavor.

Can. Light golden, small to average and mostly diminishing head. Light, malty and lightly sweetish aroma, faint - light vegetable/herbal hoppyness, light metal. Body is light, malty and lightly sweetish flavor, faint - light vegetable/herbal hoppyness, faint metal. Finish is short, malty and dryish - lightly sweetish, light vegetable/herbal hoppyness, light metal and faint alcohol. Not very enjoyable.
Aroma escaso. Poco compleja en boca, aunque con un amargor muy agradable y conseguido. Enorme bebestibilidad. Recomendable (a falta de una buena artesana).
Quite a drinkable macro lager. Was at the premium end in Tokyo (something better than the blander lagers on offer). That said was quite nice.
Nice crisp taste. Very very easy to drink. Best before a meal. One of my favourites even though mass produced. Very light.

Hvala prijatelju Ninu koji se voli penjati po planinama pa je malo svratio do japana da nam donese pive...pivo zanimljivog imena...u limenci...okus slatkast...citrus...pitko i osvjezavajuce pivo...ni?ta posebno...ok pivo..
Clear yellow color and strong on carbonation. Grain taste and sort of light and medium body. minimal on bitterness. Drinkable

Tap @ Tokyo beer museum. Appearance: pours clear straw yellow with ok creamy white head and lacing. aroma/taste: barley, breadm and floral notes.
palette: medium malty aroma, average carbonation, light to medium body, medium malt sweetness, somewhat balanced by a light to average bitterness, medium duration and a watery texture. Overall: pretty standard lager
Draft from Jam sake bar. Corn, yeast, wheat, citrus, spice with some grain and straw throughout. Pretty smooth. Though is it better than the original?

Can at the home front in Kyoto - picked up in Tokyo. Pours clear gold with a creamy white head. The nose holds simple cereal, pale grains, pale bread. Light-medium sweet flavour with minimal bitterness, some hay, pale biscuits, maybe lemon peel. Light bodied with average carbonation. Pretty OK balance in the finish, with further pale bread, lightly bitter straw, faint dough. Quite basic, unsurprisingly, but it drinks easy.
Flaska. Klar guldfärgad med ett medelstort vitt skum. Dofter och smaker av säd, vitt bröd, gräs. Krispig avslutning.

Aroma : bready
 Appearance : amber brown little foam
 Taste : lightly bitter sweet grains malty rice
 Palate : soft carbonation
very drinkable first at Fukuoka
it was exellent

A small can from Jason’s in Guting [small, because way over-priced], rated back-to-back with Sapporo Premium. Aroma: bready, rather sour. Appearance: same as the Premium, maybe a little richer amber, head dissipates completely. Palate: light-bodied, but with a pleasantly slick texture. Soft carbonation, nothing happening at the finish. Taste: lightly bitter, the texture redeems it. This is in the Beer Hunter’s top 500, and a marked improvement on the Premium, but at that price, once is enough. Merry Christmas!
Clear golden with little white head. Lots of sweet grains with some dust and normal bitter hoppy stuff. Bad.
Canned at Red Hill Bar, Takayama. Pours clear golden with white head. Malty, sweet, rice, short finish with hint of bitterness, watery. Thin bodied. Drinkable, and that’s about it.

Can, thanks to my wife for nicking out to the slev. Gold, white head stick around a while. Hay, mild spices a slight whiff of pears. Sweet and reasonably clean but empty in the middle. Dry with some spices and moderate bitterness.
35 cl can. Golden color, big white head. Lagery smell, straight forward. Aroma of sugary malts, biscuits, followed by a quite intense bitterness for the style. Metallic bitter finish, solid lager.
0.5 bottle (label with two fish). Pale gold with medium soft head. Malt and lemon aroma. Metallic bitter taste with malty final. Low bodied, lively carbonation. Decent industrial lager

35cl can from Yours Livi, Hiroshima. Pours golden with a modest, white head. Mild malty aroma with hints of fruits, grass and metal. Moderate to medium sweet with mild flavours and a light, but noticeable bitterness. Pretty standard pale lager without much flavour or bitterness to speak of.

Bitter finish

Malt

Less hop aroma

Dry, light bodied



Smooth as typical Japanese beer with more bitter finish.

33cl can
yellow~gold color
aroma of honey but wierd
flavor watery
carbonated
Average pils beer, golden color and light taste, light on alcohol as well. Had it both on bottle and can, not much difference.
Can in Tokyo Palace Hotel minibar. Golden straw body with medium lasting head. Nose is eggy, malty. Taste is standard lager with malts, wheat and some citrus bursts. Nice and enjoyable beer.

It sure goes down well, like any other Japanese pilsners. Pours pale golden. Moderate carbonation and hop.

Good one, but I cannot understand why people appreciate it so much, cause to me, the body is light and just another ordinary pilsner.
Une bière marquée par les arômes de malt et d’’épices au nez, avec une bouche assez ample et onctueuse, agréable sur les sushis

Finally got around to rating this beer. A lot of memories, it used to be slightly more expensive than Asahi, Kirin or Suntory and I had it only as a special treat as a student. Thought it was the best Japanese beer. Well, now I know better :) Pours clear golden, bit of white foam, quite aggressive carbonation. Aroma has malty character, lots of sweetness and some wet cardboard. Taste is malty-artificial sweetner-sweet. A bit of bitterness at the end and a short finish. Not really the beer I thought it is when at university but well, at least it seems to have more body compared with other big industrial beers. I guess I will still drink it once in a while.

Can at Ashton McCobb’s. Pours clear gold with a head. Aromas of malt, sugar, honey. Taste is sweet, thin, malty, bit grim finish. 


Last wee tasting of the summer
Can at ash’s. Pours clear amber, nose is sweet toffee, floral, glue, taste is dry, grassy, floral, more glue.

Can thanks to allmyvinyl.
Appearance - golden with an attractive fluffy head, some of which hangs around. 
Nose - honey or even syrup. 
Taste - same again, but somehow very thin too.
Palate - light bodied with a creamy texture and it doesn’t finish clean which is definitely an issue with lager.
Overall - if a lager doesn’t refresh you, it’s not doing anything.
Probably the best “Ordinary” Japanese beer you can buy. It is malty, good head retention, good body and nice hoppy aftertaste.
Drank as a draught. A very ordinary lager: there is not that much taste apart from a slight maltiness.
330ml can from Kyoto. Pours gold with a small head. Aroma is malt. Taste is also malts. Nice hoppy bitterness.
Kolor jasnozłoty, piany praktycznie brak. Aromat i smak jak to w lagerze, nikły, nijaki, trochę słodu, słodkawe. Nic szczególnego

The taste and the aroma is malty and bread. OK bitterness which fills the upper part of the mouth a weak moment. Okay beer but still only a lager beer. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Not as good as its varied sister flavors, this one at least shines a bit from the more expensive ingredients supposedly used.
out of a can with nabe. Malt forward with a fair amount of body with little hops....maybe some light grass in the finish. Sweet on the palate. Meh...

A 6 pack thanks to Nagashima-san. Can pours out a golden amber topped with a white head. Nose is honey sweetness wheat grain and heavy malts. Taste is lots more of the sweetness grainy malts and a touch on bitterness on the end. Not so bad.
500ml bottle into pint glass. Distant hoppy nose. Pale amber beer with rapidly diminishing head. Taste is clean with toasted malt/Weetbix finish which lingers. Not the greatest.

Clear golden colour with thin white head. Faint malty aroma with a hint of earthy mint. Thin bodied with fairly high carbonation. Clean tasting. Mint again with a touch of spiciness and bitterness on the tongue. A clear lager with some subtle differences.
Can. Clear straw yellow. Belgian lace. Odd, sweet hop nose. Bright body. Really strange sweet quality. Not great.

330ml bottle poured in a chalice.
Good Lager. Better than the previous Sapporo Premium that I’ve had.
A: Clear golden-yellow color with a huge white head which dissipates quickly leaving no lacings at all
S: Nice smell of malts
T: Good taste of malts with a balanced bitterness
M: Very light body and medium carbonation
D: Good
[ BA Review @ 7/3/2010 ]
A decent lager. A little more depth and bitterness than most European offerings. Not bad.

This is an actual beer, this first I’ve had after around 7 tinnies in Japan. You can tell too, although that doesn’t necessarily make it any better than a happosei. Nothing much to note about the flavour, it’s a bit malty, bit grainy, but a tad metallic.

BB 03/2015. Poured a crystal clear pale amber colour with a one- to two-finger white foamy head that diminished quickly to a collar and laced poorly. Carbonation low and coarse. Aroma strongly malt, slightly sweet, slightly grainy, minor hops. Taste slight sweetness with a slight bitterness; becomes more malty as warms. Quite a light body but the mouthfeel doesn’t feel watery. Smooth, crisp, light with a tart bitterness on the finish. One to drink cold and fast before it warms. Brought back from Japan by daughter Chrissie.

350 ml can bought at YATA in Grand Century Place, Mong Kok.



Clear golden honey colour; Three-quarter finger head with crumpety white foam which lasts for 1 minute; Moderate sticky lacing with notable slight carbonation; Fragrant aroma of full malt, with very light floral, thick bread, yeast, light lemon, and very light grassy hops; Close to light sweet taste of malt, with molasses, light sugar, light bread, light yeast, light lemon, light bitter hops and sharp grass; Close to light body. Thin and slightly slick palate; Mouth feel is full malt in light body, definitely Premium level. Quite sweet, mostly molasses with some sugary edge. Breadyness is not as strong as the aroma. No foul taste, pretty good… Hoppiness is very light floral, light lemon and thin grassy nose. Light lemon and strong grass in taste. Bitterness is light but notably astringent for an abrupt, light bitter sweet finish; Fairly dry after taste. Quite easy and hoppy to mouth.



Comments: This one is teasingly good. It may not be as rich and fulfilling as Suntory Premium Malt, but it’s just malty enough plus quite delightful bitter hops to dance around your taste buds. A very solid go-to lager which finally hits this city and I have more choices to put my feet up besides the reliable Carlsberg. Yes! : )

Can. Thanks mom! Clear golden with a white head. Aroma of hay, grains and some grass. Flavor has some grainy malt with light sweetness, and a rather crisp bitterish finish. Rather light-bodied. Pretty easy-drinking when served cold.
Lata de 33 cl, adquirida en un Lawson de Nagoya, Japon. Color dorado. Sabor a malta, muy suave, sin cuerpo

On tap at the Haneda airport, last beer I had while in Japan. The best prices I’ve seen all week 

Clear golden with a medium sized white head and good lacing. Aroma is grainy and sweet. Taste is light malts, grains, lemon with a solid bitterness in the finish 

Nice, one of the better lagers I’ve had here.
zapach lekko słodki, słodowo chmielowy, ziołowy. jasnozłoty kolor, porządna piana. w smaku pełne, z wyraźną ziołowo-grapefruitową goryczką.

Poured from a can in Narita, Chiba, Japan. Color is golden yellow with just a hint of orange. Thin white head with little lacing. Aroma is sweet, light grains. Taste is sweet, grainy, lightly hopped. Thin mouthfeel. Nicely carbonated. A small step above the other Japanese macros.
Bue en bouteille de 75Cl au Japon. Malts et sucres en font une bière très agréable, ronde et assez corpulente en bouche compte tenu de son degré d’alcool.

350 ml can. Clear, pale golden color, short-life minimal white head, slight liqueur aroma with alcoholic notes, light body, decent fizziness, dry alcoholic taste with some malty sweetness, dry simply medical hoppy palate. It’s too dry and alcoholic for me.

Pours golden with a white head. This is an industrial lager that I used to drink a bit of while i lived in Japan, this one was a gift from the wife when she came back from Japan last summer. 

It might have stayed a bit long in the can as there is a metallic taste to it. Otherwise there is slight diacetyl.

The beer is very light, some hop bitterness and just a little malt sweetness.
060114. Can at slowlife Niseko. Pours clear golden with a nice head. Aroma malts. Lager.

Not sure why but for a long time Yebisu I was told is the "fancy" premium lager in Japan. No idea why as it pours just about the same as the others as a fizzy gold macro lager with a similar taste profile.
~This review was made some time ago via another application, and thus the specific details (beyond numerical scores) are no longer available~
Bottle from a local supermarket. Clear golden colour with a small white head. Aroma of floral malt, and caramel. Body is light-medium, with a fairly thin texture. Carbonation is average.
Can in the hotel room in Tokyo, August 2013. Clear golden with a medium white head. Weak and boring with light malt and citrus.
Can. Pale golden colour with a white head. Aroma is fruit, malt, hop, floral. Flavour is fruit, malt, hop, floral. Thin body. Boring beer.

Forgot how sweet this was- on draught the head was like fairy floss. But that died down and once I got into the ice-cold golden goodness I remembered that it was one of my favorite Japanese macrobrews. Good hoppy bitterness, nice depth from the malts. Good stuff.
Golden beer, average head. Nice malty aroma and flavor. Slight hoppy bitterness.

Can. Pours pale golden with a small white head. Aroma of  fruitiness, malt, some spicy notes and some herbal notes. Flavor is sweet and fruity with some perfume and spices. Medium to thin body, average carbonation.

Can 330ml @ Geokkjer

Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, floral and hint of caramel, Taste is light to medium sweet and light bitter. Body is medium, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.
Draft. Clear golden yellow color, medium white head. Aroma od light citrus. Taste is biscuit and straw.
Tap at a beer hall in Shinjuku. Pale golden colour with a white head. Weak malt aroma and an equally weak flavour.

Thank you for this gift Chris.  Pours a clear pale golden with a weak white head.  Aroma consists of yeast, grain, and a bit of grass.  The taste is very grainy.  Maybe some hay.  Grainy taste at the end with a bit of yeast.  Short aftertaste.  Light body with a thin texture.  There is quite a bit of carbonation in here.  I’ve had worse.  However, since I will never find this anywhere remotely close in my part of the world, the novelty factor is pretty high.

A Japanese place on St. Mark’s, NY bottle: Pours golden with a fizzy white head. Aroma is grain, rice, and a bit of yeast. Taste is mildly bitter, very light, but with some interesting notes that remind you that this is a beer. I would even go so far as to say that there is some complexity in this beer. Anyway, it ain’t bad, but I got a soft spot for Japanese lagers.

Bottle 0,33l. Can. Pours a golden color with a small creamy head. Aroma of malty notes. Flavour is roasted malts and caramel, with a hoppy after taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle @Tokyo Season, Manchester.
Golden/straw coloured clear and sparkly body. Spare diminishing head. Flowers, perfume, grass and hay to the nose. Dry notes. Tastes of dry hops, soap and hint of pineapple. Probably better with sushi.

Can from Seven Eleven, Mito, Ibaraki, Japan. A golden coloured pour with a medium white head on top. Malty, slightly hoppy aroma, tastes similar malty, hoppy and crisp. I’ve always quite enjoyed this one, it goes particularly well with Japanese cuisine.
Can: Poured a golden color with a huge white head. Aroma light grass and lemons. Taste was grain, metallic hops, and malt.

I just saw my last Japanese premium lager rating and to be honest I’m not especially optimistic. It looks like most other premium lagers only with a touch more haze. It smells like most other premium lagers too. Mainly lager malt and very little hopping. Cool and prickly in the mouth, samey-samey golden lager flavour. Nothing terribly special, but not unpleasant either.

We organized a very interesting tasting of Lagers (basic to average quality): 16 different beers from different countries. Price range: from EUR 0.3/bt (supermarket) to EUR 3.5/bt (take-away at sushi bar). All beers have been blind-tasted; we were 4 people, great beer lovers and wanted to know If there is a difference between all these basics summer beers. Answer: no, all were more our less watery, the worst were shit.
Sapporo Yebisu was the best one.
Here is the ranking: #1 Sapporo Yebisu #2 Baltika 3 #3 Duff #4 Obolon Svitle #5 Svyturys Ekstra Draught #6 Heineken #7 Kirin Ichiban #8 1664 #9 Carlsberg #10 Burger #11 Kronenbourg #12 Pilsner Urquell #13 Königsbacher #14 33 Export #15 Tsingtao #16 Asahi

Clearly others are not pairing. This dry toasty beer is meant to be paired with rice and fish. Not only is the mouth feel paramount to enjoying your meal and beer but the carbonation and crispiness aid digestion. Smooth creamy beer which outperforms nearly all of its competition. See you at the (sushi) bar.
Eh I guess this is better than the other Japanese macro lagers but it’s still nothing special. Very light flavors and aromas of grains and malts.

17th June 2010
You know what it looks like! Semi dry and lightly crisp palate. Creamy malt. Trace of hop. A bit metallic. Just another bland lager, but nowhere near the worst.
Can. Pours golden, with a small creamy head. Aroma pleasant malty notes of bread. Flavour is roasted malts and caramel, with a very pleasant hoppines giving a nice finish. A pleasant surprise.
Somewhat better than usual Japan lagers but still light bodied and thin taste. Disappointing.

Honey gold with white head that dissipates to lacing fairly quickly.  Grassy, sweetly rotting fruit aroma.  Upfront tastes of sweet pale malt, sulpher notes coming in, getting more sweet and bitter, then shifting more to bitterness.  Lingering mild bitterness remains after semi dry finish.

Drink it cold, drink it fast.

can.  Poured clear gold with an initially large frothy white head. Sweet grainy aroma, a bit of sulpur. Mouthfeel is light, typical carbonation, dry. Sweet pale malt flavour with a vegetal quality. Lingering dry finish.
can. golden yellow with white head  . a malty aroma .  sweetish malty taste  with a dryer slightly bitter finish . medium carbonation and body . this is ok with food

Yebisu... Bottle in la @ sugarfish 1/29/12...

Darker than expected.

dry,surprisingly hoppy,slight malt.tasty and clean.

6/3/6/3/14

Medium-strong malt aroma, some sourdough bread, light hop. Clear pale straw, little head, gentle carbonation, quickly sinking lace. Light, sweet earthiness, some umami. Slight astringency, mildly bitter aftertaste. Light and refreshing. One of the better Japanese macro lagers
On tap in Tokyo. Yellow lager, slighly heavier than some Asian lagers, a touch of grain, just about drinkable, not great.

Mostly just not very interesting.  Darker and maltier than many Asian beers, which often have a heavy rice component.  This was sweet in the nose and the mouth, with a malty first impression.  Almost no hoppy bitterness.  OK appearance, golden with a small white head.  But just not very interesting, except as an example of a well made industrial lager.
Pours a clear yellow color with aroma of light golden malt.  Taste is mild malt with a slight bite of bitterness in the aftertaste.  A minor tart finish.
(Draught)  Pours a clear yellow body with a medium white head.  Aroma of corn, musty basement, and husks.  Flavor of grass, crackers, salt, and brine with a crisp mildly bitter finish.

Pours yellow with a white head. Nicely carbonated. Fresh malty aromas. Sweet malt taste with a clean hop finish. Decent texture, not too thin. Clean after taste. Nice simple lager, great when eating sushi, especially in Japan.

During my most recent visit to Tokyo I tried Yebisu Premium for the first time. Golden pour with small white head. Strong aromas of hops, co2, and malt and barley.

High carbonation, refreshing, slightly dry and bitter, very malty. Wouldn’t be falling over myself looking for it elsewhere.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

pours golden yellow, minimal head, small carbonation, ringed retention, minor lacing. Malted barley and bread on the nose. Major malts and barley up front that persist through to the end. 3/10 sweetness, aggressive hoppy 6/10 heavy bitterness, lingers on the center of the tongue, bitter follow-through, long finish. Medium-bodied, low-medium complexity, long-finish, good carry. This is definitely a food-beer; it goes well with tonkatsu, curry rice, sushi, any Japanese food really. But as a session beer, not much in terms of explosive depth or flavour epiphanies. Watery finish.
Dark golden color with small white head. Malty aroma and taste, but with fine hoppy finish.
bottle. golden, fizzy and a head that quickly disappears. standard nose and bitterness that leans towards sweetness. smooth, light body, short finish.
Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pretty plain and boring beer. I guess it’s not too bad for a pale lager but nothing really sets it apart from all the other pale lagers in the world
Can - Golden with no head. malt and also a hint of cloves in the aroma.  Dry hop and malt taste very sharp up front and doesn’t linger.
Can. Yellow colour with a white head. Both aroma and flavour are moderate to light hoppy and malty

Can , 5.5%, Chez Dirtman, Yonago, Japan. Beaten gold, vanishing white lid. Typical Euro fizz aroma; adhesive, citronella. Heavily cereal accented, flat corn taste lingering with wafer and rubber. Not great.

350 ml can @ hotel room, Kyoto. Canned 08/2011, BBE 04/2011. Rated on 11.09.2011

Rather malty and grainy aroma. A bit fresh too. Flavour is bulky with grain, corn and some sweet malt. Starchy feeling and harsh hops on finish. Not good.

Bottle with Linh at yasuda. Pours a golden body with frothy head. Aroma is sweet bready malts. Mouthfeel is thin and carbonated with notes of bread and sweet malts. Nice decent lager. Plain but nothing offensive.

(blind-sampled at Election Day Pale Lager Challenge) Pours a clear golden with little, white head. Aroma is malty with a hint of bitterness. Medium carbonation, oily texture, medium body with a short, bitter finish. The taste is a medium, balanced bittersweetness. Girlfriend says: "Another one of those boring, tasteless beers."

Can. Pours a clear golden color with a decent white head. Light grassy and malty notes. Crisp. Easy to drink. Some malt in the background. Seems more like a Pils, but I can sense a little bit of hops. Pretty decent beer, actually!

Drunk from 7-11 and Lawson many a times in Japan. also recently found it on Civic Boulevard in Taipei city in Tabaichi yakitori. I like the Yebisu all malt. To me it tastes like Ichiban but infused with stronger and sweeter malts. I get  Malt , grass, hops and even a little lemon with a mild bitter sweet finish. Better in cans than in bottles weirdly.

Rating from 07/2009. Can, gift from Japan. Golden color with medium white head. Aroma of grass, rice, some flowers. Taste, malty sweet, continues with lemon, light bitter finish. Refreshing, nothing more.
Bottle. Golden coloured beer. Dry start to the taste with malt then coming in. Hint of lemon as well. Of all the mainstream beers I tried in Japan it was my favourite.

Bottle, at Giraffe Mohadon Aksinim, pours clear golden bubbly with a nice head, aroma of cheese, malt and hay, flavors of malt, hops and mint, pretty bitter with a medium bodied, quite decent for Japanese macro lagers

25.05.2011. 0.33l Bottle. Ace Market, Paris. Yellow colour with whita head. This is some kind of strange beer with lots of different flavours. There is something with the balance..? I dont know. Good bitterness with notes of some grainy sweetness. There is also some good aromatic hop flavours.

At the Yebisu museum. Colour is deep malty amber. Good colour, lots of carbonation. Aroma is a little grassy. Flavour is mainly malt, and then a bit of hop bitterness. For what is essentially a mass produced hot weather beer this isn’t bad at all and is probably one of my favourite of the Japanese mass market beers, because of the malt character.

Deep caramel coloured body with a thinnish white head. Aroma of strong malt, with some metal mixed in. Light to Medium-bodied; Strong malt flavour, not much else in the taste, but quite bitter. Aftertaste is strong as well, no sweetness nor hops, just maltiness and bitter flavours. Overall, not horrible, just not great. I sampled this 500 mL bottle purchased at a local Isakaya in Akasaka, Tokyo, Japan on 03-August-2010.

Can: Golden, almost clear, small - slowly collapsing - fluffy head; strong metallic traces in the bitter-grainy/strawy nose, accompanied ba a light acidity; light to moderate bitter-sweet flavour, light to medium bodied; short bitter-sweet finish followed by a light tartness. Yuk, deserves a call-back campaign.....
Smooth and refreshing in character, fruity aromas of grapes and clover, mild bitterness in the finish. Not quite special, but appealing nonetheless.
can from pivnizub - thanks! Clear golden colour, large white head. Malty nose. Medium-bodied, nice malty base with good grassy hop flavours. Yes, this is good.
Bottle 330ml. Not bad, but pretty boring. Aroma of straw. Taste is sweet, with light bitterness, and average length. Palate is thin and watery. Yellow, with a frothy head.

On-Tap at the Yebisu Beer Museum in Tokyo. Pours a dark golden color with a decent head that fades to some lacing. Has a sweet roasted malt aroma with a hint of spice. Roaste malt flavor with a nice touch of bitterness. has a clean finish. Light body, quite smooth. Drinkable brew. Nice change from the standard Japanese beers. Worth a try.
11.3oz bottle in a shaker.  Pours light golden.  Aroma of a malty pale lager.  Flavor about the same.  Nothing special but a pale lager that I don’t feel awful for drinking.
dark golden color. White head. Richly fermented barley malt aroma. Full body a little on the thicker side. with a nice hoppy finish.
Good clean all malt lager. Very typical of Japanese lagers, but a step up from Kirin Ichiiban or Asahi Super Dry.

Can found in Paris. Decent pillow of head, clear yellow colour with stormy carbonation. Aroma is a faint mixture of cardboard and wood. Taste is, uh, well, missing. Seriously, it tastes like nothing! The palate is decent and smooth, lingers on the tongue. I couldn’t taste anything, and I even tasted this warm. This puts the "pale" in "pale lager".

[300ml bottle, Peckham’s (Bruntsfield), Edinburgh] Bright, golden coloured lager, highly carbonated. Basic down the line Japanese lager. Doesn’t have much of an aftertaste, doesn’t really linger. Might be a good thing. I’ve had far worse, however [12112007]

Bottle at Cherry Blossum Japanese restaurant in Cairns. A yellow beer with a thin white head. Malty aromas with grassy hops on the nose. Taste is noticeably maltier and drier than a standard Sapporo lager. Finishes with a light dry hop presence. Clean palate with a medium-light body. Refreshing. Decent.
Pours a pale straw yellow, nose is nonexistant, taste is clean and crisp, a little soapy.
Canned.  A urine gold coloured beer with an off-white ring of head.  Really stinky corny smell which is off-putting from afar.  Sweet and corny in the mouth.  Husky and farty.  Not nice.

clear yellow, almost no head.
aroma of corn , sweetness.
flavor is dry, bitter hoppy, some sweetness.
Bottle from Ranch 99. Somewhat bitter taste. Plain palate and aroma. A little heavy. Would not recommend. Poor finish and overall experience. Funny name .. you will understand if you are Russian

Bottle from a sushibar in Nørre Alle Århus. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Light malty and hoppy aroma. Very light bitter flavor. Short light bitter finish. Not bad but very light and watery palate.
Bottle from Peckhams. Clear light golden colour, large white head. Aroma is sweet malty. Flavour is malty, harsh, metallic. Dry and bitter finish. Unpleasant.
Bottle from Peckhams. Strong sweet hoppy rice aroma. Pale golden yellow colour. Very dry bitter rice flavour slightly atypical for a pale lager.

334ml bottle. My 1st Japanese beer rating.  Gift from Scott - thanks Scott.  Crystal clear orange gold hue, white to off white bubbly head, quickly diminishing, fair lacing. Aromas of honey, sweet grains, cereal, hay.  Flavour is moderate to medium-heavy honey sweet.  Medium body, watery to syrupy texture, light tingly carbonation, short bitter finish.  Certainly is mellow and is easy drinking.  Although not cloyingly sweet one bottle at a time is enough for me. OK as a beer and fairly decent for a pale lager.
Bottle. Medium head with medium duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are malt and hops.
Can@Home. Very grainy as expected from something Asian. However also very hoppy and bitter. I didn’t expect that. Finish is pretty metallic what makes it quite hard to drink.
Solid pale lager--taste is primarily malt but fairly refined, clean, and balanced compared to, say, Latin American pale ls. Pleasantly surprising (at a Japanese restaurant in NYC)

Sweet malt, mild floral, and grain aroma.  Golden, white bubbly head with mild lacing.   Full bodied lager, light sweet at first and ends in medium bitterness.  Mild carbonation with a bitter-dry finish.  decent lager
bottle - pours dark yellow with a small white head. The aroma is sweet and malty. The flavor is corn syrup and rice.

500mm Can - 
Can Labelled "Sapporo Premium Beer (Imported)". Researching this name it appears to be another  name for Sapporo Yebisu. 

Clear pale gold with short lived white head. Medium carbonation. Sweet some hoppiness but overall weak and bland with a light bitterness.
From a bottle.  Light, clean gold with light head.  Hops, spice, honey.  Waterly.  Medium body that finishes with bitterness and sweetness. A bit overpriced.

Japnese beer rating at Tiddes, sponsor Kras, 2009-11-27, can AP: golden, high white head. AR: malt, hops, herbs F: malt, hops, herbs 
Wage aromas and flavors this one was the worst at this test!
Bottle.  Pours a clear gold with a nice white head.  Malts and faint hops on the nose.  Flavor is malty and grainy and pretty watery, but not terrible.  What you’d expect from a Japanese macro.

Appearance: Golden
Aroma: slightly earthy, grassy and slightly floral hops, moderately honeyed/ripe pear and orange malt 
Flavor: Fruit malt (like the aroma) is balance by restrained but ever-present bitterness. Finishes with a long, soft bitterness and lightly roasted grain notes.
Palate: Smooth
Comment: Leans a bit towards sweet malt, though fairly well balanced by the hops.  Well-made but a bit innocuous. They aim for a mellow brew and that is what you get.
Gold pour, small white head.  Mostly sweet malt, some grain, very faint hops.  Drinks like water.

Draught.
Lightly amber tinted golden color. Sweet malt is very well balanced by bitter noble hops. Not much hop aroma, but good bitterness. Much better fresh and on tap. Really a darn good major.

334 ml bottle from Systembolaget, Nordstan. Tiny white head. Brilliant, pale gold colored body. Modest aroma of dry, grainy malts with some faint hoppy notes of hay and metal. Soft, light sweet malt flavor, backed by some rather unfresh, grassy hops. Body is light plus. Dryish ending. Clean, but kInd of mellow, and rather bland.

Bottle 33cl.
Clear light yellow orange color with a small to average, fizzy, good lacing, mostly diminishing, white to off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, rice, fruity, corn. Flavor is moderate sweet with a average duration. Body is light medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft. [20090517]
The Lexus of Sapporo.  Balanced, smooth, yet flavorful.  Rather expensive due to its production origin.

500 ml can from Japan (thanks Pa!), shared with Luc, served cold in a tulip glass. MA26/09.



App.:  Clear golden with a fair white froth.
  
Aroma:  Light, minerally cereal/grain, a touch fruity, a touch of grassy/peppery hops, a little mustiness.
  
Palate:  Medium body and carbonation.
  
Flav.:  Malt/cereal, biscuit, toast, light grassy hops, really light fruitiness; dry with some bitterness.



Certainly not bad.

334ml bottle. Golden amber in colour with a rich softly compressed white head and good clarity and carbonation. Nice sweet malt aroma with a crispness to it. Medium bodied with a mellow malt flavour, good session beer.
Drank it at San Shi Go in Laguna Beach.  Typical Pale Ale, no taste, watery, but drinkable.

Bottle, at Copenhagen Beerfestival. A clear, slightly pale golden beer. Dms, grains and some hops in the aroma, not very good. Can’t say I like the flavor either, still dms and grains, and some hints of bitterness. Some bitterness in the finish too, still not much. Thin and dry mouthfeel. A poor beer, didn’t even find it quenching. (090517)

Can. Very special tanks to Johan B for this one!
Pours cristal clear orange. White head. Aroma is little grassy. Flavor is medium  sweet malty. Palate is smooth and pleasent.
Bottle 33 cl. Clear yellow with a small white head. Aroma of malt and sulphur. Medium-bodied, sweetish malt, a little sulphur and a dry finish. Drinkable. 300509
Bottle.  A pale ale with a light yellow white head.  Some light grass y notes, grain, and a hint of floral hops, not bad for a PA.

330ml bottle (St. Urho’s, Helsinki)

Simple lager aroma - at first quite German, but in retrospect it’s like Estonian macro stuff.  However, there’s some pepper too. Crisp palate. Sweet, soft, gentle, oh whatever - this is just so boring. Didn’t kill us and didn’t make us gag. Maybe I’m a bit harsh, the hops come over as a bit of pepperiness in the taste and the finish, so at least it has some character. (4:2:4+:2:9=2.1+)

Labelled as Yebisu Premium. A golden lager with a thick white head. A rasther light malt aroma with light hops. In mouth,  a sweetish malt with light metallic hops, grassy, grainy, medium bodied. 500 mL can shared rom probstk, May 26 2009.

0, 35 l can.Poured clear yellow with a small white head. Moderated aroma of sweet buttery malt, some hop. Sourish yeast in the medium-weak body, light malt taste, grassy hop in the finish. Balanced but avarage  lager one.
Can bought back from Japan by my brother. Light clear golden, no head. Aroma with touches of honey, DME & light peppery hops. Medium sweet with a light peppery mouthfeel & finish. OK
Pours a golden color with a white head.  Aroma is pilsner malts, honey, vanilla, some floral notes, and peppery hops.  Flavor is malty, grain, honey, and a nice peppery bitter finish.
Bottle from New Beer, nyc.  Pours light, but dark for the style.  Taste was malty with notes of hay.   Mouthfeel was medium.  Carbonation was abundant, but unrefined.

Quite malty and hoppy but, not altogether too bitter. Clean with the alcohol taste really standing out. A bit of a metallic tinge, which I find out of place. On closer examination, there is a teeny little bit of fruit and spice in the flavour. Somewhat of medium body beer.
Low white head on a yellow body. This beer does not taste very different from other Japanese beers. Not bad, but not brillant either
12oz from a japanese market in san diego.  Pours gold with a bright white ring.  Nose is eh.  Taste is slightly better.  Overall some what crappy.

Pours a pale yellow with a fluffy white head.
Aromas are quite skunky, with a grassy hops and cereal malt. Hints of apple, and a peppery spice. 
Flavours are very malty, with a mild hop bitterness. Strange, spirit-like (vodka?) taste. Very clean on the palate, but leaves a soapy aftertaste. Otherwise, nice and refreshing. Not bad.

Bottle 330 ml, 
Appearance: deep gold with light thin top that vanquished quickly. Rather poor appearance. 2- Aroma:  plain grainy aroma with slight sour-alcoholic edge. 4- Flavour/Palate:  medium bodied, fair malted chanter with hint of bitter rawness. Finish – hops much more notable with positive effect on this rather dull lager. Good ingredient is not all, only start.

middle yellow color,white head dissapears quickly
smells of malt and hoppy,(hidden floral) 
tasts malty ,hoppy, some hidden cookies
aftertaste some bitterness

Bottle. Clear yellow, slight head. Steely slightly vegetably hop aroma. Light body with fluffy carbonation. Light pleasant malt with reasonable steely hop bitterness. Overall refreshing and drinkable.
Smells a bit strongly of malt. A quickly gone but good-looking head. This is pretty good. Some malts up front. Dryness and hops in the finish. An easy-drinking light brew.

Bottled 334ml. It pours a golden beer with a decent white head. Pleasant nose with hints of cereals, melon and tobacco. Slightly metallic. Grainy taste. Medium bodied. Slight bitterness. Malty. Melon and tobacco showing up again. Metallic. Dry finish. The alcohol is a little too present. (this beer reminds me a bit of a malt liquor).

Bottle from BevMo, La Mesa. This had better be good, considering it’s price. Light straw in color. Slightly sweet grainy aroma. Grainy flavors with a bit of malt. Some spiciness. Good for a pale lager, but still far too expensive.
Pale golden colour with medium dissapering head.Aroma is malty with some taste of corn,and hops light grainy with malty finish.

19-Mar-08 (334-ml bottle: Purchased 17-Mar-07 for $2.99 at Holiday Wine Cellar in Escondido, CA)  Pale golden in color with gorgeous clarity and a fluffy, semi-rocky, white head that builds to almost half an inch before settling to a thin layer.  Aromas are very grainy, sweet, somewhat corny and very lightly hoppy.  For an all-malt beer, this is smelling perilously close to a macro.  On the palate, this light-bodied beer doesn’t really distinguish itself much from macros either.  Mildly sweet, grainy malts lack the character of better pilsener-style lagers, and at best, hops add a touch of flavor and bitterness.  Carbonation is medium to high, the bubbles are large and rough on the palate, and the combination leads to a rather bloating feeling in the stomach.  If the label didn’t say this is an all-malt beer, I’d tend to think it was a slightly better version of an adjuncty pale lager.
12oz bottle from BevMo Mission Valley.  Not worth the $4 price tag.  Tasted like a beefed up Sapporo, nothing special.
Pours a golden yellow with a rocky white head that goes in about a minute. Decent lacing left. Aroma of malt and some cinnamon. Taste is malty and metallicy. Fizzy.

From Sushi+, Aarhus, DK.
Bottled, 170708.
Yellow with small head. Aroma is weak of malt. Flavor is slightly sweet with some malt.
Considered Sapporo’s flagship, this showed more German heritage than the plain Sapporo, but still didn’t do it for me.
Bottle at Sticks’N’Sushi. Clear yellow - white head. Malty, sweetness, grainy, hay, crispy. OK - a bit plain.

I’m getting an orange zest smell, maybe a touch of baked bread aswell. The colour is a golden haze, nothing so special as to start a craze. 

The taste is better than some other japanese brews, watery and light but give it its dues.

A tartness towards the end of the glass, on a six pack i would not pass.

Having said all that it’s still not great. Ill give it a 10 minus 8.

Appearance: Pale golden. Little bit of head.
Aroma: Fruity and hoppy. Lemony.
Taste: Pretty complex. Fruity, bitter and hops. Bitter aftertaste.
Info: 334ml bottle, 15/2-2007, 163/300, 144/500

Weak head back top mild foam cover on a gold pour carbonation good.Aroma is malty,lemon.Flavour bitter hops,sweet,malt is okay.This is a little too sweet,I like bitter sweet but have a limit.Sweet finish dry.

(Bottle) I think this beer is miscategorized as a "pale lager" and I have a hard time understanding why it has such low reviews.  This tastes more like a typical German Dortmunder/Helles, except without the richness of the malt.  There are a lot of hops and the hops have a German character to them...good, somewhat metallic, but not unpleasant.  Moderately bitter; much more bitter than is typical for something called a "pale lager".  The main thing lacking about this beer is that it is extremely thin, to the point of being very watery.  Still, it’s a perfectly drinkable beer.  There is no unpleasant sweetness the way there is in most pale lagers.
Pours a dark straw colour. Sweet juicey malt nose, medium palate with a slightly nutty malt base. has a good finishing hop kick that rounds it out nicely.

334 ml botle from Mitsua Market Place:  Pale golden color with a medium white head. Aroma is ligtly sweet and malty. Flavor is light and sweet with a lightly grassy bitterness and a crisp dry finish. Light body is oily with moderate carbonation.

Straw yellow color with moderate big- bubble, transient, white head.  Sweet malty aroma of corn/grain and some hops.  Taste is similar with a fairly dry and bitter finish for a macro.  Thankfully, it is without adjunct off flavors.
(Yokosuka, Japan) From a can poured a clear golden color with a fair amount of head.  Flavor of any normal macro lager, with a quick finish.

Can thanks to Garrett. Pours a light golden with a thick white head. The aroma was mostly a metallic skunk. The taste was malty and some bready sludge, this reminds me of so many lagers I’ve drank till I was sick. Not exactly bad memories, but beer wise, this was pretty bad.

Good sized bright white head of fine bubbles.  Reduces slowly to a sloppy rocky mess.  Corn and dry uncooked rice in the aroma.  Maybe some diaper in there also but not skunky at all.  Color is a dark gold.  Light carbonation.  Pretty fizzy mouthfeel but a considerable malt body to this one.  Much more than I expected.  Light corn again a bit of sweetness.  Pretty clean with a light bitterness.  An ok lager.  Has a little more body than most but not much else to brag about.

334ml Bottle - The Liquor Collection - Honolulu, Hawaii 

Aroma – Smelled skunked from the time it was open until it was drank.  Very stale and light struck.  

Appearance – Light golden yellow color, decent fluffy head and clear. 

Flavor – A typical over brewed malt beer with very little flavor and very skunked in the flavor also.   
 
Palate – Slick pale Mouthfeel, some texture with a bland dry finish. 

Overall – Had to try it so I can add it to I have tried them all list.  It was pretty nasty actually a very poor beer in my humble opinion.

Bottle from Berkeley Bowl. Light, malty aroma with a touch of hop. Golden color with decent white head that even laces in tatters. Near medium body with moderate carbonation. The flavor is spicey! Must be really good noble type hop. Very impressive. Finish is dry and decently bitter. Quite smooth. Amazingly good.

334ml bottle: random.   Gold with a fluffy white head.   Some cardboard and light hops in the aroma.   Pretty thin flavor, and definitely not enough malt to make the light, yet sharp hops work very well.   Still, nothing very repulsive about it.
Bottle, poured a clear straw gold with a large foamy head. Not a bad lager, quite malty with a surprisingly creamy palate.
Eh, typical mass produced beer. Almost exactly like a pale lager. Not much aroma, big thick head, pale yellow color. Very malty for its appearance, though. Still, worth picking up.

Bland and watery malt flavor with overtones of rice. Alcohol flavor is sharp and overpowering. Some hops at the finish, but bitter aftertaste left in the mouth. Overly carbonated creamy mouthfeel. Drank this out of the can while  girlfriend shopped in Harajuku.

Japanese big company lager is a terribly bad segment (worst in the world?) but this beer is the clear standout. Real malt character here, no surprises I guess given the 100% claim. A decent if basic beer. Some bitterness to finish.
Typical Japanese lager. Quite refreshing, far from offensive but totally uninspiring. Sampled from a bottle at a Japanese restaurant in the city.
veyr light and golden, nice round sweetness and strong hop bitterness for this style.   hop aroma is almost a little citrus / mint

Deep gold with a fluffy white head. Aroma of cereal grains, some apple and very modest hops. Flavour is possibly a little heavy in sweetness for the style but not entirely offensive. Not a whole lot going on.

This tastes just like a dodgy pale lager, with none of the bready malt that I would expect from a Dortmunder. It was malty, but it was all sweet and hollow and a bit sickly. Some harsh bitterness, again with no real depth to support it. Rather unimpressive.

Bottled, sampled at Haket, Göteborg. 
Pale golden colour. Creamy white head. Rich malty nose, along with pooh. Light malty in flavour, with some sweetness and low bitterness. Not very nice, hence the pooh in the background.

(Bottle) Pours golden. Sweet and grainy aroma with tones of rice and some wet mash. Sweet and light hoppy flavour with notes of grass and rice. Light bitter with a dry ending. Some honey tones both in the aroma and in the flavour. Light bodied.

It is interesting, and somewhat incongruous I think that Japanese restaurants don’t serve finer beers than this.  Alas, until the early 1990s microbrewing beer in Japan was all but prohibited.  So, we get the "Big 4":  Suntory, Kirin, Asahi, and Sapporo-- lagers all.  I miss ale.  That said, these, lighter beers still seem very heavy alongside most Japanese cuisine.  With sashimi and sushi, I think that sake is almost always a better bet than beer.  This beer was on tap at a restaurant in Kyoto which served excellent Japanese food, but I have to admit the beer just didn’t fit the bill.  Compared to the rest of the Japanese macro lager cosmos, however, this is probably near the top.  It is crisp with a lively palate the hops come with a little sour tinge which is unattractive.

Light golden with a weak head. The aroma has notes of malt and grain and the flavour is very malty/grainy, slightly sweet and sour and not much other than that. It has a very light bitterness and is very boring. 2368

Bottled.
Pale golden. Brief, white head.
Some faint grassy aroma overwhelmed by sour rice/maize.
Light bitterness and a bit malty flavour.

Bottle, 50 cl, bought at Haket, Göteborg, Sweden. Clear yellow, medium flat head. Odd malt aroma, with clear notes of rice, and some touch of rubber. I could also sense some alcohol and was surprised when I realized that the abv is just 5 %. Light to medium bodied, quite smooth. Decent balance with a fairly long finish. Overall a not very good beer.

Bottle at Haket-Göteborg:  Clear yellow colour,flat head. Aroma of rice(?),grazy,hay,citric,and grainy and a dry hopy/sweet ending. Flavor is almost the same here.Thin watery mouth feeling.Thin body,and short finish.

12 oz can.  Very pale golden beer with a thick white head.  Aroma is quite subtle, thin pale malt, a bit of metallic character that isn’t so nice.  Flavour is very thin and watery and completely lacking in character.  Moderate bitterness but with so little malt, it is fairly prominent.  With a bit of shaking, the metallic character dissipates, becoming a less offensive, but still pedestrian lager.
500 ml bottle. Clear golden color, weak head that quickly disapates, bold malty aromas. Taste is clean and nutty, light hops. Mouthfeel somewhat watered down. Well balanced finish.

(500 ml bottle at Haket, Göteborg) Labeled "Yebisu Traditional Brew Premium" 5% ABV. Clear pale golden color, huge white head. Acidic, almost lemonish, scent. Acidic malty taste with a metallic undertone and some grains. Medium mouthfeel, low bitterness.
Sweetish aroma, dark redish brown color, tan head quickly disappears.  Taste is non-remarkable.

Thin white head. Yellow body with carbonation. Sweetish grassy aroma with malty background. Dryish grainy grassy hop taste. Clean palate. Dryish grassy aftertaste. Quite good, and lightly hopped. (0.5l bottle.)
Gold Color with White Head.  Alot of Rice on the Nose.  Sweet Malty Grains and Rice Flavor. Sublte Overall...Light Dry Ending.

Can, 48 hours away from Japan from my friend Takihero. Golden with a layer of white foam. Clean grainy malt aroma, delicate herbal hops, a touch of brine. Smooth round bread, given brightness with a lively level of carbonation. The backdrop of hops show of a bit more as the sip finishes, a bit of lingering tartness. Hop presence grows a bit through the glass. My expectations for this were for a fairly bog standard lager, but this is actually rather nice.

A gift from Tim E. A balanced well made beer that didn’t do much for me. I understand this is a Japanese standard and by that standard it blows the major Canadian beers out of the water. Page 407 of Michael Jackson’s Great Beer Guide and only 260 of his 500 Classic Brews to go.

Pours a crisp gold with a large fluffy white head.  Aroma is uninspiring.  Slightly sweet malts with just a touch of hops, and metal. Body is medium to light with plenty of fizz.  Flavor is of sorta sweet.  I don’t notice any hops, but there is some malt in it.  It’s not terrible, but it’s trying.

Clear golden color.  Minimal, rapidly dissipating head.  Very light, somewhat faint, sweet, malty aroma.  Malty, sweet, hoppy flavors.  Pretty basic, but well-balanced.  Not bad.  A decent offering from a Japanese macro.

Tynd fyraftensøl (33 cl. flaske).

Kedelig øl med normal kulsyre, som dog er god til at slukke tørsten med eller drikke sig fuld i.

Ikke særlig humlet eller bitter.

Hvis der er andre muligheder at vælge i mellem ville jeg aldrig vælge denne.
Can. Pours clear gold, white head. Aroma is malt and candy. Flavor is malt, bitter, slightly sweet banana.

Yebisu Premium All Malt Traditional Lager Beer. 50 cl. can. Nice golden colour with a big average lasting head. Aroma of malts and hops. Fresh flavour of slightly toasted malts, little hoppiness, touch of sweetness and little bitter-sweet aftertaste. A pretty good brew, one of the very best "lighter" brews from Sapporo.

Maybe a touch above the Kirin, Sapporo, and Asahi macros I’ve been drinking here in Japan, but not by much. Lots of rice and phony malts underneat a beer that finished with a decent hop profile. However, this beer was originally served at something like 40F, so it clearly was in stealth mode, trying to avoid flavor detection. As it warmed, it just turned more and more adjunct-laden tasting. Appearance was originally golden with a nice white head, very decent lacing for a macro pale lager. An ok beer, definitely decent for a pale lager style, but just not worth my liver.
A bit better than your average macrobrew...but only a bit...very light, although reasonably enjoyable taste
Aroma: bland dusty lagery notes with a bit of malt. Apperance: yellow with a fluffy white head. Flavour: some malt, hop notes and a touch melony. Palate: ok mouthfeel but still thin.

Bottled. Golden colour, small white head. Aroma is hops, malts and either rice or maize (maybe both?). Flavour os rice, hops and slight maltyness. Not exciting at all, and quite typical Asian "pale" beer.
Aroma of lager malts and grassy hops. Taste has grassy herbal hops, lager malts with a touch of honey, a bit of bitterness in the finish.

yep yebisu is brewed by sapporo. shit! its like a tricky bud thing here. this one i had on the plane and didnt care for too much.  pungent off metalic flavors swirled with a sweet alcohol taste at only 5? strange.
Golden, quite nice white head. Bready aroma and a bit fruity. Hoppy, grassy, metallic flavor. Quite a standard lager.

Can.  This is Sapporo’s "premium" product, because it’s all-malt, and under Japan’s weird beer-tax laws, that makes it the most expensive.  It is actually somewhat better than most of their beers, but worse than their flagship "Sapporo Draft".  Basically a generic pale lager, but there is a bit of nondememo  maltiness imparting some modicum of taste, although no hops at all.  Not exactly exciting stuff, but by the standards of Japan’s macrobrewers, it’s ok.
Bottle. Hazy golden colour with a mediumthick white longlasting head. Dry malty and grassy aroma. Malty flavor with some hoppiness. Dry malty bitter aftertaste.
Dark gold color with a thin head.  Very grassy aroma, almost like a weaker Biere de Garde.  A lot of rice taste, getting to the point of the jet fuel sake.  Some spiciness on the finish.

Can, "All malt beer"

Golden yellow, small white head. Papery malty aroma. Light, watery body. Some grassy hops can be found in the flavor. A bit soapy taste. Not the worst pale lager but could have more solid malty backbone.
Bitter malt aroma. Cryatal clear amber colour with poor head and no lacing. Light malt swet flavour. Flat palate.
3 Feb 06 - Typical Euro pils light sweet-hop aroma.  Clear yellow-amber colour, low head but good suds lacing.  Light sweet and low malt flavour.  Light sweet hoppy finish.
Bottle. Pale golden colour with a big white head. Malty, grassy aroma and taste. Light body with a light dry finish. Boring!

so i’m in transist, couldn’t get ahold of TimE, but I’m still up because my body is a bit confused about what timezone it should actually be in. tokyo has been fun, and i just bought a tallboy of this beer, as well as a snack called CRUNKY POPJOY! anyway... not a bad brew; golden straw body with little white head; fuel, grain, a little bit of sweetness, slight floralness, not that bitter--not much of much; what can i say!
Pours a clear golden yellow color.  Aromas of grass, cheerios, and a touch of flowers.  Flavor is kinda sweet to start, citrusy finish with some hop notes.
Had this one on draft in Japan, like many Japanese beers taste like old english or king cobra malt liquor, garbage that looks good

Acceptable Japanese lager, dry in style, but not as dry as your asahi/sapporo regulars. Pleasent appearence and nose, slightly sweet malts (this is relevatively compared to a standard japanese dry beer) and bitterness combine to a nice lager.
Pour is clear golden yellow with a thin fast fading white head...smell is sour grain and a little hoppy...taste is thin and sour with lots of corn...sour aftertaste...
Can. Golden, minimal ghost of a head across the top. Sweet melon and mandarin aroma. Sweet melon flavour balances the harshness of the hops. Not a bad canned beer for the park.

Not a great beer, but I didn’t expect to like it much at all, considering that I’m a hophead. dark gold color, easy drinking, but had enough flavor for me to actually like it abit. I’d drink it again, with sushi!

Golden colour with thin head. Malty bready aroma. Very flat on the palate. Neither offensive nor exciting (I definitely couldn’t pick out any of the undertones of flavour that some of the other raters have!)

Tasted this one after returning home on compo from a workplace accident. Probably should have went with something a little stronger, but this seemed a good starter and I was quite impressed with their Black beer. Pours a clear honey gold with a thin lather of white bubbles formed by the irregular carbonation. Grainy and bitter aroma, quite dry with a zest of fruity esters like navel oranges and grapefruit. A lot of citrus in the mouth, thin bodied and quite crisp in carbonation. Very clean, light mouth feel, bitter in the back, more a tang than grassy, and finishes off with a long clean citric swallow. Judging by most of the ratings this is not one that is universally the same. The sample I tasted, though, was quite a refreshing light lager that would be a great summer quaffer. Certainly better than most Japanese Lagers.
Pale yellow swill.  Skunky bitter flavor, but not really hops bitterness.  Not good at all, but not really bad, at least as judged by my palate that has been wasting away in China.
I’ve tasted a lot of bad beers...and this is one of them.  It stinked and tasted worse than the smell.  My wife was amazed as she watched me pour it down the drain.
Thanks to IslandHaole for this one.  Pours canary with aroma of hopcit, slight honey and thiols.  Tastes malty, with hopcit and a slight malty dryness at the finish.  Highly carbonated.

Misleading name on the label. A bright gold and slight red color. A thin white head. The aroma is sweet with ginger and some cherries. The tastes are drier. Notes of raisins, black pepper and some woody freshness.Really, a pretty good lawnmower beer.
clear bright golden colour, almost no foam, corny aroma, oily with a robust malt body, dry and tart slightly bitter finish - unspectacular

Hello Bruce....make me another Unagi...Good beer to wash down sushi.   seems to stand up to the strong fish and salty sauces really well.  But nothing extraordinary on it’s own.  I understand that their brews on tap in their tasting rooms are altogether different.  Someday...Sapporo!

Kuala Lumpur: The description of this suggests a beer brewed according to the Rheinheitsgebot. It does have a typical Euro flavour and more body than most of the Asian lagers around here. Good value at about $2 a can, in these parts anyway.
A golden beer with an OK, but disappearing white head. The aroma is malty sweet and so is the flavor, that also contains an OK hoppy bitter end.

The only place I could get this in my area is the Sesame Inn (Bruce & Betty are good folk), but they had to drop it since my buddy RAYBOY01 & I were the only two to order it as we glombed down on sushi. Deep yellow color, highly carbonated, but with a whispy, disappearing head.  Clean taste.  Nothing special, but goes well with the food.

Can, Kuala Lumpur, Yebisu Premium All Malt Beer
Blond beer. Nothing special, but well balanced. Refreshing and acceptable.

Yeeeeeeebisuuuuu!!!! Hmmmm.  Tasted in Toronto.  Obtained as gift from the far east.  Tasted in dimple mug.  Pours black, very small light head, tan colour.  Aroma is of grain, malt with a slight sour/sweetness.  Taste is fairly muted and watery.  Has a somewhat buttery mouthfeel, oily.  What I can pick up is a noteworthy image of Yeeeebiiisuuuuu!!!!!!
Light golden in color with a large dense white head. Mellow grain and hop aroma. Sweet malt flavor with moderate bitterness and hop character. Finishes clean and dry.
Slightly hazed orange body. Medium frothy white head. Breadt malty aroma. Straight forward malt flavor. Medium-light body. Nt bad nor terrible. At least there are no adjuncts.

Well I luv Sapporo cermanic filtered beer.  Had to give this beer a shot.  As ususal good presentation.  Nice light gold, complex aromas, excellent bubble action, good head and all around a good lager beer!  The beer has a slight bitter after taste like the reserve at the end.  Lots of aroma on German hops which is quite beautiful!!  I luv the smell of beer!!  Highly Recommended!!

my bottle says all malt beer in place of stout draft, but I believe it’s the same beer.
aroma, appearance, flavour and palate are all pilzneresque, with a little bit of sweet floral hop aroma, well made beer but nothing special.
Lighter yellow in color with a white head. Smells and tastes of malts and yeasts. Nothing special (and it is a labeled a stout draft!).
Inoffensive mix of malt and light yeast flavors.  You can notice some hops as it warms up.  Great to wash down sushi.
Orangish/yellow cloudy colored with a white head...chewy apricot aroma with cereal maltiness..thick apricot meat flavors..some certeal...this was an interesting japanese beer, i say.

Bottle. Definitely not a "stout" as I know one to be. It poured an average sized white head with fine-medium sized bubbles. The body was hazy and uncarbonated with a pale yellow hue. The nose was malty, hoppy and somewhat sweet. The flavor was nothing to write home about that's for sure. The mouthfeel was thin and this was a light bodied beer with no lacing. I definitely do not recommend this one, but then again, that's up to you.
Well it doesn’t look like a stout beer.  My first Japanese brew.  I guess if they think this is stout...  Well they can have it.  Strange.  I didn’t care for it much at all.

This bottled brew is mislabeled as a Stout Draft when it is actually a light pale colored ale.  Its head was large and foamy with fine to medium sized mostly lasting bubbles that left behind a poor lace.  The body was a slightly hazy uncarbonated straw yellow color and in no way looks like a stout draft or otherwise.   The aroma was malty doughy floral and a bit grainy.  The mouth feel was a smooth malt hop one with a flat finish.  The flavor contained mild DMS somewhat astringent and otherwise malty and doughy.
Piss yellow. Patchy white head and a few spots of lace. Biscuity malt nose with an edge of dusty honey. Some sweet/tart apple notes. I wouldn't really call it a helles but it's pretty tasty.

This is better than the other japanese beer that I have tried. Not saying that it is great but half decent for a refreshing drink. Pale straw colour, very little head, hop aroma, grassy taste and a metallic finish.

Why the heck is the word "stout" anywhere on this bottle?  In any case, grainy malt aroma, faint hint of hops.   Hazy golden color, OK head.  Decent body, lightly hopped.  Not an all bad sushi beer, beats the heck out of regular Sapporo.

pretty light colored for a stout draft--i expected a darker beer.  foamy white head with some lacing on the glass, and a rich citrusy malty aroma.  some hops in the nose as well, but subdued.  this is a very malty beer;  nothing special, but much better than regular sapporo.

100% fine malt eh - why, what else would they use, 24.725% crap malt, 19.132% stale malt and the rest fine malt??? Pours like a soda pop with a pale orange gold under a small white very short lasting head. Very faint sweet malt aroma. Medium to thinish but quite smooth body. Medium corny malt and medium light grassy bitter hops flavour. Some harshness in the stale bitter aftertaste.
A little more flavorful than most other Japanese beers. Clean malty flavor throughout with a decent hop bitterness. Perhaps a little too clean in the flavor department.

1st off, why in the heck does it say "Stout Draft" on the label, it sure isn't a stout has we know it. Maybe they mean stout as in strong or sturdy, and if that's the case, they missed the boat on that too. This straw hued beer has a small head and no lace. This aroma was very twangy hop fruit, light malt, and cornmeal. The taste was grassy and bitter with a metallic and watery feel. Can you say DMS? Well, I've had worse. Guess it would work okay with fish.
Very light color with a fizzy pop head. Aroma has lots of burnt plastic and malt in it. Flavor is harsh and full of dms. Finishes sharp and overall just a not so impressive dortmunder.
Skunky, yellow, thin lager. Stout Draft? Cool bottle with the Sapporo logo in raised letters in the glass above the label. Maybe they should add rice.
crystal clear golden body with a shit load of big carbonation.  Corn and funkiness, dry and light damaged.  watery and weak, rather disappointing.

malty aroma, big bubbles and overall shitty appearance, weak and watery with slight malt presence and slight fruitiness overall pretty bland, this one lost major points from the blatant false advertising on the bottle, in Gabby's words "That's not a stout"
Yellow pour with a little head and little lacing.  Flavor is pretty mild with a sweet overtone.  Works well with sushi.

Fizzy yellow liquid with a frothy off white head.  Interesting that the bottle states "Stout Draft". Herbal/floral aroma with a hint of honey sweetness and as it warms some bread yeast. Initial malt sweetness followed by a light perfumy bitterness. Light alcohol in the finish.  A pizza and a beer, type of brew.

at the nippon club in sydney. expected better from an all malt helles. but it was thin, seemed weak, there was no character to the hops apart from metallic bitterness. but don't let that put you off the nippon club, one of downtown sydney's cheapest bars
Actually not so bad a beer.  Clear golden body with medium off-white head.  Aroma is very malty.  Taste is sweet, malty, with hint of grassiness.  Decent body.

Ha! The bottle says "stout draft", so I was expecting a stout! Instead I got a rather yellow and clear Helles.  NOt much nose, but luckily a bit of a sweet malt taste that drued to a grassy finish. This style bores the hell out of me, but this was better than most I've tried. Seemed very fresh.
Honey colored, slightly cloudy, hardly any head or flavor really. Wasn't too bad once it warmed up a little. Served it's purpose which was to wash down some Japanese food.
Interesting yellow beer.  Light and clean.  Somewhat malty.  No discernible hops going on.  Not terribly good really.
Yellow, golden hue.  Small sticky white head.  Grainy nose.  Tastes pale and watery.  Light bodied, not much going on.  Metallic tasting.  Im not terribly impressed by this at all.
How can I compliment this one? If urine in a bottle were coveted, then this would get a 20. Still, better than Bud so I can't give it all ones.
Pretty average beer.  The color is a little like copper/orange and the flavor is forgetable.
Generous head. Faintly hoppy aroma. Tastes like a big-brewery lager. Not bad but not too exciting.
Sweet soapy aroma and grainy sweet palate. Bitter finish but also a little sourness. I was confused by the name "stout draft" on the label.

Golden color with fast dissipating off white head.
Light malt sweetness in nose and flavor. Very low hop rate.

An interesting brew that delivers far more hop value that one would traditionally expect from dry Japanese ale. I''m a big fan of IPA and ESB''s, and love sushi, so tend to scope this one out when I''m looking for something a little different with some fresh cut fish. Sapporo''s regular beer''s are quite uneventful, but the Stout Draft from their Yebisu brand is a nice alternative.

This one, like traditional Japanese lager/pilsener styled beers, pours very very light, with moderate carbination and little to no head. Because of the high hop count, the aroma on this one is quite pungent and may catch many off guard. 

The name itself is quite a misnomer, calling it a stout, when it''s anything but that. It''s mildly spritzy, almost fruity, and delivers a heck of a punch in the aftertaste department. It''s not a beer that I''m wild about simply drinking on its own, but as an accompaniment with some great food, this beer is definitely a winner.

Well, it''s ot a stout in anyway, shape or form but it is a decent beer (with food). Light gold color, no head, too much carbonation, flat taste. Stick with standard Japanese brews Kirin and Sapporo Draft. Bought at sam''s in chicago for $2.49
It''s ok but I was expecting a little more. Nothing special at all..........

Big head with big bubbles rising. Yellow-gold and clear. Rather watery texture; kind of buttery. Has a synthetic, "beery" macro flavor with a moderate amount of bitterness in the finish. Dryish, bland aftertaste. One of the better Asian beers I''ve had; take that as you will.

Misleadingly labeled "stout draft," this brew was blonde-gold with moderately rising carbonation and a creamy head that settled nicely. The aroma was of a sweet pilsnerish and alcohol I have come to expect of dortmunders--possibly with the appearance of malt and straw. The flavor is deadened though it has corn syrupy notes and some skunkiness at the back of the palate. One of the more drinkable dortmunders I have so far tried,

Straw color. Head dissipated quickly. Aroma was barely there but slightly sweet. Moderate body. Nice clean malt flavor. Grassy notes. Carbonation slighty too high, bites the tongue. Lingering hop dryness in finish. 

Didn''t appreciate it stand-alone, but it paired quite well with california roll and spicy tuna sushi.

When I asked the waitress at a local Japanese restaurant what beers they had, she began naming the usual. When she said "Yebisu," I stopped her and asked what kind of beer that is. She replied, "Oh, it''s a Japanese stout." Naturally, I was interested (always looking to try a new stout). Needless to say, I was greatly dissapointed with what I got. On the label, it says, "Stout Draft." Anyway, it''s not a terrible beer. A slight malty aroma, and just a little bitterness in the finish. Basically decent.

Has a soft hoppy aroma with a pale malty appearance. Light somewhat musty flavor with a sweeter aftertaste.  The hops taste like they spent a few months on a cargo ship in the Pacific.  If this were governed by US laws, the Better Business Bureau would have them remove the word "Stout" from the label.  I''d say it''s better than most American macros, but not by much.
This stuff tastes like a 40, but better.....................................
Deep gold color. Fat and frothy head. Malt and slight floral aroma. O.K. lace. light malt and hop taste. Not too watery. Better than I surmised.

a dortmunder all right, so marks for getting within a discernible style at least. apart from the fact that it gets it''s own exciting category at ratbier, there isn''t to much to say about this stuff. light, but syruppy mouthfeel. at first it''s really dry, then leaves behind an unclean cheesy bitterness. prefer suntory malt''s for a japanese dortmunder.
Light gold color.  This beer has a malty aroma, finish was so bad...........
Little aroma, yellow with nice carbonation and solid head.  Even malty flaovr with bitter end.  Dry.  OK.
Interesting orange color, and a fairly decent flavor, nice malt tones.  However -this is nowhere near the best beer of this type that I have had.

Pale Golden Color with medium thick head.  Fairly strong malt aroma with very slight hoppy bitter undertones.  Slightly sweet malt flavor.  This is a good beer but why they call it a stout draft is beyond me.

Medium straw color, medium head. A medium bodied draft style lager. Nicely malty with a nice hop bite. Clean and crisp taste. Light taste but with some flavor. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and round. Finish is crisp and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly bitter. Nice beer. I don&#8217;t mean to go on a rant here, but STOUT DRAFT is confusing!!
I had this in Kyoto, Japan.  Pale yellow with some rising bubbles.  Diminishing white head.  Crisp and dry with a medium body.
A good brew and the best available next to Ginga Kogen beers................

This beer is a study in contradictions: The label calls it a "Stout Draft" in one place (and who knows that that is), then it reads "100% malt" and  "brewed from 100% fine barley malt and select hops" elsewhere. Which is it?

Anyway, this is definitely the best Asian beer I have come across so far, but still not a great brew. Still, I think Sapporo may be on to something. Pours a very orange color with a medium off-white head. Medium sweet malt aroma. Lightly sweet malt flavor and medium effervescence. There was some hops in the finish but everything seemed understated about this beer. Nothing really stood out, but if I am in Japan I will order this before a Sapporo or Kirin.
Not all that bad, i could dig this brew. It wasn't the best, but it was a different beer, and it served its purpose of tasting like an average beer and containing some alcohol
I want my money back...it has the word "stout" on the bottle but it's anything but.  -1 on appearance for deceptive advertising.  Skuny aroma, maltiness, mellow flavor, nothing remarkable.

I thought this was a perfectly good representation of the style. Even when room temp it never got too corny, or sickly sweet. It held it's own. It's not a world-killer helles, but it has all the right oily maltiness...mmmm. Fairly solid.
A clear dark gold color. Some citrus and malty sweetness but still obviously a Japanese made beer. Has a dry lingering aftertaste. Had this at the Osaka Kansai airport for breakfast with Okonomiyaki

Clear dark gold in color, the head is white and generous, the lace is adequate. Nose is all malt, very little else to notice. Front is sweet, the top light, the finish is acidic, dry, and has a hop presence. Ranks #955 on my master beer list.

a well made dortmund export style lager.  crisp and mildly hopped.
........
More flavor than most Japanese beers - misled by the word stout though - but not bad.  Beats all of the "dry" Japanase beers I'm usd to.

5/3/2003 - I bought this again because under the "Yebisu" on the label it says "Stout Draft" - Now doesn't that sound to you like it's gonna be a stout?  Well, NO, it's still this Dortmunder style  - and lucky me I just came home from dinner at Applebees - the only good beer they have is our local Great Lakes Dortmunder Gold - So how do they compare???  This has the same flavors, but diminished and lighter.  Color is two shades lighter; palate is thinner; The flavors present are almost exactly the same, but the Yebisu tasted almost watered down.            Original rating:  I was somewhat surprised at this.  had more hops and character than i expected.  still, it was a bit thin.  dortumder? hardly. couldn't hold a candle to GreatLakes Dortmunder Gold.
Very clean and refreshing.I couldn't detect any hops though.Pretty standard Japanese lager.

Typical Japanese sushi lager cranked up a notch. I went to the local Japanese market looking for black beer and couldn't resist a bottle that said stout on it but was clearly not. Gold, sparkly, small head, aroma hoppy w. a bit of that old sour barroom smell. Flavor is bitter, metallic, hoppy, a touch sweet. Frankly, I think if you're going to have a Japanese lager with your sushi, your better of with something lighter, as I found that the flavors didn't react well to each other.
Fizzy, yellow, adequate Japanese brew.  It's not all that different from a Sapporo.  A light sushi beer.
Decent enough for a Japanese lager.  I'll give this a shot with sushi sometime and see if I like it better than Ichiban.
nice citrus aroma, slightly cloud golden color, very clean refreshing taste, excellent choice with heavy food
Golden coloured. Sweet and malty with rather low bitterness. Average........

Head is initially average sized, frothy, white, fully diminishing. Body is clear medium yellow, light density of small particles. Aroma is moderately hoppy (flowers), moderately malty (light bread), lightly yeasty (dough). Flavor is moderately sweet, moderately bitter. Finish is moderately bitter, lightly acidic, slightly metallic. Light to medium body, watery texture, fizzy carbonation.  Without the metallic aftertaste, the Flavor score would have been a point or two higher, but still one of the better light lagers from Japan that I've come across.
